title: Horsie (two part round)
body:
Horsie, Horsie, on my way
We've been together for many a day
So let your tail go swish and your wheels go round
Giddy-up, we're homeward bound
I like to take a horse and buggy
I like to travel through the town
I like to hear those hooves go clip-clop
I like to see those wheels go round and round

title: Little Pony
body:
Gee up little pony, la da da da da da
Take me round the town
Take me round the town
We'll see all of London, la da da da da da
In her evening gown.
And away, we, go go go go go go go go go

title: Beautiful Baby
body:
Beautiful baby, just living on love
the sandman says maybe, he'll take you above
up to where birds fly on ribbons and bows
where babies float by, just counting their toes.

title: Shortnin' Bread
body:
Mama's little baby loves shortnin' shortnin'
Mama's little baby loves shortnin' bread
Mama's little baby loves shortnin' shortnin'
Mama's little baby loves shortnin' bread
I went to the doctor and the doctor said:
"Feed that baby on shortnin bread"
Mama's little baby loves shortnin' shortnin'
Mama's little baby loves shortnin' bread

title: My Pretty Baby (two part round)
body:
Sleep tight, Sandman's a-coming
And he'll be here, mighty-mighty soon
So if you don't cry, he'll be coming by
With a great big yellow balloon.
How I love my pretty baby
Sweet and tender little baby
How I love my pretty baby
Honest to goodness I do!

title: Little White Duck
body:
There's a little white duck sitting in the water,
a little white duck doing what he oughter,
he took a bite of a lily pad,
flapped his wings and he said "I'm glad
I'm a little white duck sitting in the water.
Quack! quack! quack!"
There's a little green frog swimming in the water,
a little green frog doing what he oughter,
he jumped right off of the lily pad,
that the little duck bit and he said "I'm glad
I'm a little green frog swimming in the water.
ribbit! ribbit! ribbit!"
There's a little black bug floating on the water,
a little black bug doing what he oughter,
he tickled the frog on the lily pad,
that the little duck bit and he said "I'm glad
I'm a little black bug floating on the water.
bzzz! bzzz! bzzz!"
There's a little red snake playing in the water,
a little red snake doing what he oughter,
he frightened the duck and the frog so bad,
he ate the bug and he said "I'm glad
I'm a little red snake playing in the water.
hiss! hiss! hiss!"
Now there's nobody left sitting in the water,
nobody left doing what he oughter,
there's nothing left but the lily pad,
the duck and the frog ran away, I'm sad
'cause there's nobody left sitting in the water.
Boo! hoo! hoo!

title: Red Robin
body:
When the red-red robin comes bob-bob-bobbin along,
There'll be no more sobbin'
When he starts singin' his old sweet song,
"Wake up, you sleepyhead, Get up, get up, get out of bed.
Cheer up, cheer up, the sun is red. live, love, laugh and be happy.

title: Baby Bunting
body:
Bye, Baby Bunting,
Daddy's gone a-hunting
To catch a little rabbit skin
To wrap my baby bunting in

title: Cottage in the Woods
body:
In a cottage in the woods, a little old man by the window stood
Saw a rabbit hopping by, knocking at the door.
Help me, help me, help me, he said.
Or the hunter will shoot me dead.
Come little rabbit, come with me.
Happy we will be.

title: Timpanogos<em class="dedicated"> dedicated to Brian Riddle
body:
Timpanogos, mighty Timpanogos,
Timpanogos, mountain that we love.
Mountain with itsâ€¦

title: Little Lambs
body:
Little lambs, so white and fair, are the shepherds constant care
Now he leads his tender sheep into pastures green and deep.
Now they listen and obey following where he leads the way
Heavenly Father may we be thus obedient unto thee.

title: Little Green Valley
body:
I see a candlelight down in the little green valley,
Where morning glory vines are twining â€˜round the door.
Oh, how I wish I were there tonight,
Down in the little green valley.
That's where my homesick heart will trouble me no more.
There's only one thing ever gives me consolation.
And that's the dream that I'll be going back someday.
Now every night down upon my knees.
I pray the Lord to please take me,
Back to that little old green valley far away.

I hear a mockingbird down in the little green valley,
He’s singing out a song of welcome just for me.
And someone waits by the garden gate,
Down in the little green valley.
When I get back again, how happy she will be.
And by a little babbling brook, once more we’ll wander,
And in a shady nook, we’ll dream the hours away,
And I will leave all my cares behind,
Go where I know I’ll find sunshine,
Back to that little old green valley far away.

title: The Nothing Song
body:
We sing nothing, nothing, nothing, we sing nothing all day long,
We sing absolutely nothing, how d’ya like our nothing song?
(Spoken) Second verse, same as the first,
Couldn’t be better so it’s gotta be worse: (Repeat first verse)

title: Johnny Verbeck
body:
Oh, once there was a Dutchman, his name was Johnny Verbeck,
He used to deal in sausages, and sauerkraut, and speck.
He made the finest sausages that I had ever seen,
Until one day he invented that machine.
Chorus

title: My Blue Heaven
body:
When whippoorwill’s call, and evening is nigh,
We’ll hurry to my blue heaven.
A turn to the right, a little white light,
Means we’re happy in my blue heaven.
We’ll see a smiling face, a fireplace, a cozy room,
A little nest that’s nestled where the roses bloom
Just Molly and me and baby makes three,
And we’re happy in my blue, blue heaven.
Make your own

title: Long, Long Trail
body:
There’s a long, long trail a-winding,
Into the land of my dreams.
Where the nightingale are singing,
And the white moon beams.
There’s a long, long time of waiting,
Until my dreams all come true,
Till the day when I’ll be going,
Down that long long trail with you.

title: Mariah
body:
Oh, way out west they got a name,
For rain and wind and fire,
The rain is Tess, the fire is Joe,
And they call the wind Mariah
Mariah blows the stars around,
And sets the clouds a-flying,
Mariah makes the mountains sound,
Like folks up there were dying.
Chorus:
Mariah, Mariah,
They call the wind Mariah.
Before I knew Mariah’s name,
And hear he wailing whining,
I had a girl and she had me,
And the sun was always shining.But then one day I left my girl,
I left her far behind me,
And now I’m lost, so good and lost,
Not even God can find me.
Repeat Chorus
Out here they got a name for rain,
For wind and fire only,
But when you’re lost and all alone,
There ain’t no word but lonely
And I’m a lost and lonely man,
Without a star to guide me,
Mariah blow my love to me,
I need my girl beside me
Repeat Chorus
Mariah, Mariah,
Blow my love to me

title: Homeward Bound
body:
In the quiet misty morning when the moon has gone to bed,
when the sparrows stop their winging and the sky is clear and red.
When the summer’s ceased its gleaming,
When the corn is past its prime,
When adventure’s lost its meaning,
I’ll be homeward bound in time.
Chorus:
Bind me not to the pasture; chain me not to the plow.
Set me free to find my calling and I’ll return to you somehow.
If you find it’s me you’re missing, if you’re hoping I’ll return.
To your thoughts I’ll soon be list’ning in the road I’ll stop and turn.
Then the wind will set me racing
As my journey nears its end,
And the path I’ll be retracing
When I’m homeward bound again.
Repeat Chorus
In the quiet misty morning when the moon has gone to bed,
When the sparrows stop their singing,
I’ll be homeward bound again.

title: Morning Has Broken
body:
Morning has broken like the first morning,
Blackbird has spoken like the first bird.
Praise for the singing, praise for the morning,
Praise for them springing fresh from the world.
Sweet the rain’s new fall, sunlit from heaven,
Like the first dewfall on the first grass.
Praise for the sweetness of the wet garden,
Sprung in completeness where his feet pass.
Mine is the sunlight, Mine is the morning,
Born of the one light Eden saw play.
Praise with elation, Praise ev’ry morning,
God’s recreation of the new day.

title: Mistress Shady
body:
(sing the week once, twice, and then till you run out of breath)
Oh, Mistress Shady
She was a lady
She had a daughter
That I adore
I used to court her.
I mean the daughter.
Every Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday afternoon at half past four.

I remember once at a Riddle Family reunion
Grandpa Riddle sang two weeks more than anyone in the room.

title: The Happy Wanderer
body:
I love to go a-wandering,
Along the mountain track,
And as I go, I love to sing,
My knapsack on my back.
Valleri, Vallera, Valleri, Vallera-Ha-ha-ha-ha-Ha-ha
Valleri,Vallera,
My knapsack on my back
I love to wander by the stream
That dances in the sun,
So joyously it calls to me,
Come join my happy song.
Valleri, Vallera, Valleri, Vallera-Ha-ha-ha-ha-Ha-ha
Valleri,Vallera,
Come join my happy song.
I wave my hat to all I meet,
And they wave back to me.
And blackbirds (Bluebirds) call so loud and sweet
From ev'ry green wood tree.
Valleri, Vallera, Valleri, Vallera-Ha-ha-ha-ha-Ha-ha
Valleri,Vallera,
From ev’ry greenwood tree.
High overhead, the skylarks wing,
they never rest at home
But just like me they love to sing
as o'er the world we roam
Valleri, Vallera, Valleri, Vallera-Ha-ha-ha-ha-Ha-ha
Valleri,Vallera
as o'er the world we roam.
Oh, may I go a-wandering
Until the day I die
Oh, may I always laugh and sing
Beneath God's clear blue sky
Valleri, Vallera, Valleri, Vallera-Ha-ha-ha-ha-Ha-ha
Valleri,Vallera
Beneath the clear blue sky

title: John Jakob Jingleheimer Schmidt
body:
Repeat 4 times getting quieter, except for Full volume Da-da etc. Last time silent.
John Jakob Jingleheimer Schmidt
That’s my name, too
Whenever I go out
The people always shout, singing
John, Jacob, Jingleheimer Schmidt
Da, da, da, da, da, da, da, (da).

title: To This Land
body:
When I first came to this land
I was not a wealthy man
So I bought myself a shack
And I did what I could
And I called my shack
Break my back
But the land was sweet and good
And I did what I could
When I first came to this land
I was not a wealthy man
So I bought myself a cow
And I did what I could
And I called my cow
No milk now
And I called my shack
Break my back
But the land was sweet and good
And I did what I could
Duck—out of luck
Wife—run for your life (or trouble and strife)
Son—my work’s done

title: Try To Remember
body:
Try to remember that kind of September
When grass was green and grain was yellow
Try to remember that kind of September
When life was slow and oh so mellow
Try to remember that kind of September
When you were a tender and callow fellow
Try to remember and if you remember
Then follow  follow, follow ,follow
Try to remember when life was so tender
That no one wept except the willow
Try to remember when life was so tender
That dreams were kept beside your pillow
Try to remember when life was so tender
That love was an ember about to billow
Try to remember and if you remember
Then follow  follow, follow ,follow Deep in December it’s nice to remember
Although you know the snow will follow
Deep in December it’s nice to remember
Without a hurt the heart is hollow
Deep in December it’s nice to remember
The fire of September that made us mellow
Try to remember and if you remember
Then follow . . .follow your heart

title: Ryedale
body:
When the Riddles first saw Ryedale
It was in the month of June
They said this is a lovely place
And we’ll be moving soon, singing
Chorus:
Come you all to Ryedale,
Come you all, heigh ho!
Come you all to Ryedale,
You’re welcome here, you know.
The apples they grew round and red
And sweet and juicy, too;
We called up friends from far and near
And gave them quite a few
Repeat Chorus
First we got the Topie cat
And then the Brownie cow
Two bantam hens and Raider dog
But we don’t have them now
Repeat Chorus
And on a lovely summer day
As summer turned to fall
The nicest new arrival came
A baby boy named “Paul”
Repeat Chorus

title: Utah Trail
body:
You ask me where I’m going, so early in the morn’.
I’m just a traveler roamin’, just a-roamin’ on.
I’ve searched the whole world over,
Many times I’ve searched in vain
For a spot that seems like heaven to me
And I long to see again
Chorus:
Oh, I’m going to hide away, far out on that Utah trail
Moonlight’s as bright was day, far out on that Utah Trail.
That’s where I’ll settle down, in a peace where all is still
In a little hut just built for two tucked away in the heart of the hills
And, there ‘neath the skies are blue in the golden summertime
That’s where all friends are true and all nature is in rhyme
Someone is waiting with a love that never fails
Waiting patiently to welcome me far out on that Utah trail
The golden leaves of autumn,
The verdant greens of spring.
Will linger on forever
Will fondest mem’ries bring.
When as a boy I wandered
Through the woods and swimming holes
And at evening time the setting sun
Turned the hills from green to gold
Repeat Chorus

title: Roll on Columbia
body:
Chorus: Roll on Columbia, roll on. Roll on Columbia, roll on
Your power is turning the darkness to dawn
Roll on Columbia, roll on.
Green Douglas fir where the water cuts through
Down through the mountains and canyons he flew
Canadian northwest to the mountains so blue
Roll on Columbia, roll on.

Repeat Chorus
At Bonneville now there are ships in the locks
The waters have risen to cover the locks
Boatloads aplenty now steam to the docks
Roll on Columbia, roll on.
Repeat Chorus
Other big rivers give power to you
Yakima, Snake, and Hood river too
Sandy, Willametter, Klickitat, too
Roll on Columbia, roll on.
Repeat Chorus
On up the river is Grand Coulee Dam
The biggest thing made by The hand of man
To harness the river and water the land
Roll on Columbia, roll on. . .
Repeat Chorus

title: Puff the Magic Dragon
body:
Puff the magic dragon lived by the sea
And frolicked in the autumn mist in a land called Honalee
Little Jackie Paper loved that rascal Puff
And brought him strings and sealing wax and other fancy stuff
Chorus: Oh, Puff the magic dragon lived by the sea
And frolicked in the autumn mist in a land called Honalee
Puff the magic dragon lived by the sea
And frolicked in the autumn mist in a land called Honalee
Together they would travel on a boat with billowed sail
Jackie kept a lookout perched on Puff's gigantic tail
Noble kings and princes would bow whene'er they came
Pirate ships would lower their flags when Puff roared out his name
Repeat Chorus
A dragon lives forever, but not so little boys
Painted wings and giant's rings make way for other toys
One gray night it happened, Jackie Paper came no more
And Puff, that mighty dragon, he ceased his fearful roar
Repeat Chorus
His head was bent in sorrow, green scales fell like rain
Puff no longer went to play along the cherry lane
Without his lifelong friend, Puff could not be brave
So Puff, that mighty dragon, sadly slipped into his cave
Repeat Chorus

title: On Top of Old Smoky
body:
On top of old smoky, all covered with snow,
I lost my true lover, for courtin’ too slow.
For courtin’s a pleasure, but parting is grief;
A false-hearted lover is worse than a thief.
A thief he will rob all, the money you save,
But a false-hearted lover, puts you in the grave.

title: On Top of Spaghetti  Parody of On Top of Old Smoky
body:
On top of spaghetti, all covered with cheese,
I lost my poor meatball, when somebody sneezed.
It rolled off the table and onto the floor,
And then my poor meatball, it rolled out the door.
It rolled down the sidewalk, and under a bush,
And then my poor meatball was nothing but mush.

title: Mormon Sunday School Song
body:
Chorus:
Young folks, old folks, everybody come
Join the Mormon Sunday School and have a lot of fun
Check you kiddies’ cheerios and raisins at the door
And you’ll hear some scripture stories you ain’t never heard before

title: Frog Kissing
body:
You remember in the fairy tales,
When the wicked witch’s spell
Changed the handsome prince to a toad.
Through the power of a potion
She handed him the notion
He was lower than the dirt in the road.
Although she left him green and warted
Her evil plan was thwarted
When he happened to chance by a young miss.
Who in spite of his complexion
Offered her affection
And changed the wicked curse with a kiss
Chorus:
If you’ve never been frog kissing
Then you don’t know what you’ve been missing
There’s a world of opportunity
Under each and every log
If you’ve never been a charm breaker
Then you’ve never been a handsome prince maker
Just slow down, turn around,
Bend down and kiss you a frog
Once upon a time ago when I was down and feeling low
Like a lowly frog in a pond
My life was just a joke and I was very nearly croakin’
I was zapped by life’s wicked wand
But in the depths of my depression, there came a true expression
Of love from a man so sweet
He gave me warm, fuzzy feelings, feelings that were healing,
And swept me off my little webbed feet.
Repeat Chorus
There’s a happy-ever-after land, deep within the heart of man
Where prince and princesses abide.
But all we get are glimpses of the handsome prince and princess
“Cause they’re covered with a green, warty hide.
And though they’re full of life’s potential,
They’re lacking one essential to enable them to shine like a star
And that’s a handsome guy or missus to smother them with kisses,
And love them while they’re just like the are.

Repeat Chorus
Just slow down, turn around, bend down,
And kiss you a frog!

title: Clementine
body:
In a cavern, in a canyon,
Excavating for a mine,
Dwelt a miner, forty-niner,
And his daughter Clementine.
Chorus:
Oh, my darling, oh, my darling, oh, my darling, Clementine,
You are lost and gone forever, dreadful sorry Clementine.
Light she was, and like a feather(fairy),
And her shoes were number nine
Herring boxes without topses
Sandals were for Clementine
Repeat Chorus
Drove she ducklings to the water
Every morning just at nine,
Struck her foot against a splinter
Fell into the foaming brine
Repeat Chorus
Rosy lips above the water,
Blowing bubbles mighty fine,
But, alas, I was no swimmer,
So I lost my Clementine.
Repeat Chorus
In a churchyard near the canyon
Where the flowers grow and twine
There grow roses ‘monst the posies
Fertilized by Clementine
Repeat Chorus
In my dreams she still doth haunt me
Robed in garments soacked with brine
Though in life I used to hug her
Now she’s dead I draw the line
Repeat Chorus
Now ye Boy Scouts, heed the warning
To this tragic tale of mine
Artificial respiration
Would have saved my Clementine
Repeat Chorus
How I missed her! How I missed her!
How I missed my Clementine!
Till I kissed her little sister,
And forgot my Clementine.
Repeat Chorus

title: Eddy-Koocha-Kacha-Kahma
body:
Chorus:

Eddy-Koocha-Kacha-Kahma Tosanaratosanoka SammaKamma Wacky Brown
Fell into the well, fell into the well, fell into the deep dark well.
Suzy Jones, milking in the barn, saw him fall
So she ran to the house to tell her Ma that
Repeat Chorus
Suzy’s Ma, making cracklin' bread, told old Joe
She told him what her Suzy said that,
Repeat Chorus
Then old Joe, laid aside his plow, grabbed his cane,
And he hobbled into town to say that
Repeat Chorus
To the well, everybody came, what a shame,
That it took so long to say his name that
Eddy-Koocha-Kacha-Kahma Tosanaratosanoka SammaKamma Wacky Brown
Eddy-Koocha-Kacha-Kahma Tosanaratosanoka SammaKamma Wacky Brown
Drowned

title: Sweet Violets
body:
There once was a farmer who took a young miss
In back of the barn where he gave her a
Lecture on horses and chickens and eggs
And told her that she had such beautiful
Manners that suited a girl of her charms
A girl that he wanted to take in his
Washing and ironing and then if he did
They could get married and raise lots of
Chorus:
Sweet violets, sweeter than all the roses,
covered all over from head to toe
covered all over with sweet violets
The girl told the farmer that he’d better stop
Or she’d call her father and he’d call the
Taxi which got there before very long
Cause someone was doing his little girl
Right for a change and so that’s when he said
If you marry her son you’re better off
Single cause it’s always been my belief
Marriage will bring a man nothing but
Repeat Chorus
The farmer decided to wed anyway
And started out planning for his wedding
Suit which he purchased for only a buck
And then he found out he was just out of
Money and so he got left in the lurch
Standing and waiting in front of the
End of the story which just goes to show
All a girl wants from a man is his
Repeat Chorus

title: Michael Row Your Boat Ashore
body:
Michael row your boat ashore, Hallelujah
Michael row your boat ashore, Hallelujah
Sister help to trim the sail, Hallelujah
Sister help to trim the sail, Hallelujah
Michael row your boat ashore, Hallelujah
Michael row your boat ashore, Hallelujah
The Jordan river is deep and wide, Hallelujah
Milk and honey on the other side, Hallelujah
Michael row your boat ashore, Hallelujah
Michael row your boat ashore, Hallelujah
Take me to the promised land,Hallelujah
Hear the trumpet sound so grand, Hallelujah

Michael row your boat ashore, Hallelujah
Michael row your boat ashore, Hallelujah
Trumpet sound the jubilee, Hallelujah,
Trumpet sound for you and me, Hallelujah
Michael row your boat ashore, Hallelujah
Michael row your boat ashore, Hallelujah

title: Bought Me a Cat
body:
I bought Me a cat, my cat pleased me,
I fed my cat under yonder tree.
My cat says fiddle eye fee.
I bought me a duck, my duck pleased me,
I fed my duck under yonder tree.
My duck says, “Quaa, quaa”,
My cat says fiddle eye fee.
I bought me a goose, my goose pleased me,
I fed my goose under yonder tree.
My goose says, “Quaw, quaw”,
My duck says. . .
I bought me a hen, my hen pleased me.
I fed my hen under yonder tree.
My hen says, Shimmy shack, shimmy shack”,
My goose says. . .
I bought me a pig, my pig pleased me.
I fed my pig under yonder tree.
My pig says, “Griffey, griffey”.
My hen says. . .
I bought me a cow, my cow pleased me.
I fed my cow under yonder tree.
My cow says “Moo, moo”,
my pig says . . .
I bought me a horse, my horse pleased me.
I fed my horse under yonder tree.
My horse says, “Neigh, neigh”,
My cow says. . .
I bought me a wife, my wife pleased me.
I fed my wife under yonder tree.
My wife says, “Honey, honey”,
My horse says “Neigh, neigh”. . .

title: Mr. Toad
body:
Oh the clever men at Oxford know all that needs to be known
but they none of them know one half as much as clever old Mr. Toad
The world has held great heroes as history books have shown
but never a name goes down to fame compared to that of Toad
The army all saluted as they marched along the road
Was it the King or the President? No it was Mr. Toad
The judge was apoplectic, he thought he might explode
he'd never been faced with a prisoner as bold or as brave as Mr. Toad
The police could never catch him he was so nimble-toed
he escaped from their clutches for none knows as much as the amazing Mr Toad
The officers couldn't believe it they oohed! and ahhhed! and ohhed
as high up above them he flew like a bird the incredible Mr. Toad
Oh nobody knew how to catch him so clever and nimble-toed
they couldn't snitch or snatch him, that elusive Mr Toad.

title: Black Socks
body:
Black socks, they never get dirty,
The longer you wear them the stronger they get.
Sometimes I think I should wash them,
But something inside me says No, no, not yet.
Not yet, not yet, not yet...

title: Down by the bay
body:
Down by the bay
Where the watermelons grow
Back to my home
I dare not go
For if I do
My mother will say
Insert Line here
Down by the bay

title: Ants Go Marching
body:
The ants go marching one by one, Hurrah!! Hurrah!! The ants go marching one by one, Hurrah!! Hurrah!! The ants go marching one by one, The little one stopped to suck his thumb, And they all go marching down, Where? to the ground,Why? to get out of the rain.

  • Two by two/Tie his shoe
  • Three by three/Climb a tree
  • Four by four/Slam the door
  • Five by five/Take a dive
  • Six by six/Pick Up sticks
  • Seven by seven/At a 7-11
  • Eight by eight/close the gate

title: Cider Through a Straw (Repeat After Me song)
body:
The prettiest gall(guy)
I ever saw
Was sippin’ cider
Through a straw
The prettiest gal I ever saw
Was sippin’ cider through a straw
I asked her if
She’d teach me how
To sip some cider
Through a straw
I asked her if She’d teach me how
To sip some cider through a straw
First cheek to cheek
Then jaw to jaw
We sipped that cider
Through a straw
First cheek to cheek, then jaw to jaw
We sipped that cider through a straw
And now and then
That straw did slip
And we’d sip cider
Lip to lip
And now and then that straw did slip
And we’d sip cider lip to lip
And now I’ve got
A mother-in-law
And nineteen kids
That call me “ Paw”
And now I’ve got a mother-in-law
And nineteen kids that call me “Paw”
The moral of
This little tale
Is sip your cider
Through a pail
The moral of this little tale
Is sip your cider through a pail

title: Pink Pajamas
body:
I wear my pink pajamas, in the summer when it's hot.
I wear my flannel nighties in the winter when it's not.
And sometimes in the springtime and sometimes in the fall,
I jump right in between the sheets with nothing on at all.
Chorus:
Glory, glory, Hallelujah;
Glory, glory, What's it to you?
Balmy breezes blowing through ya,
With nothing on at all.

title: Guten abend, gut’ Nacht
body:
Guten abend, gut’ Nacht, mit Rosen bedacht,
Mit Näglein besteckt schlupf unter die Deck!
Morgen früh, wenn Gott will, wirst du wieder geweckt,
Morgen früh, wenn Gott will, wirst du wieder geweckt.
Guten Abend, gut’ Nacht, von Englein bewacht,
Die zeigen im Traum dir Christkindleins Baum.
Schlaf nun selig und süß, schlaf im Traum’s Paradies
Schlaf nun selig und süß, schlaf im Traum’s Paradies
